review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2024
review_body: This is comprehensive and very interesting. It has all the info I was looking for in one book.

brand: The Complete Book of Herbs: A Practical Guide to Growing and Using Herbs
name: The Complete Book of Herbs: A Practical Guide to Growing and Using Herbs
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2024
review_body: I love the depth and details from planning, to planting to harvesting to propagation.  Great recipes, medicinal uses, photos.  What a great value for cost.

brand: The Complete Book of Herbs: A Practical Guide to Growing and Using Herbs
name: The Complete Book of Herbs: A Practical Guide to Growing and Using Herbs
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2008
review_body:
This is an excellent book, but there are a couple of drawbacks. First, and most annoying, is the ordering of the herbs by scientific name. Makes it hard to find the herb you're looking for. Second, it's a large book, takes up a lot of space on the table and doesn't fit on all shelves.It has served me well enough, but I recently came across
  
Your Backyard Herb Garden: A Gardener's Guide to Growing Over 50 Herbs Plus How to Use Them in Cooking, Crafts, Companion Planting and More







  
  
    and I have to say this is the book I would pick up instead, in retrospect. I may even buy it anyway. It's small, has all the reference information in this one (and then some), and more readily available.

brand: The Complete Book of Herbs: A Practical Guide to Growing and Using Herbs
name: The Complete Book of Herbs: A Practical Guide to Growing and Using Herbs
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2024
review_body: Lots of info fast and easy shipping

brand: The Complete Book of Herbs: A Practical Guide to Growing and Using Herbs
name: The Complete Book of Herbs: A Practical Guide to Growing and Using Herbs
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2016
review_body: Bought this book used.  It was in great shape.  I don't remember seller mentioning that there was writing in the book although I found this to be a nice surprise.  There isn't much and it's not blocking anything.  I found it charming.  The book itself has some nice designs for herb gardens.  There are beautiful live pictures of the plants including the roots, seeds flowers and leaves.  Some have pictures of the seeds and leaves when dried.  Each plant has a little history and description.  Book gives lifespan (example Hardy Shrub), and height.  It also sections on Cultivation; propagating, growing, harvesting, and preserving, Uses; Culinary, Cosmetic, Aromatic, and Medicinal.  The book is a bit larger than I expected so it's not one you could carry easily as it's about 14 inches by 8 inches.  These are guestimates.  :)  I am very happy with the book and look forward to using it for many years.

brand: The Complete Book of Herbs: A Practical Guide to Growing and Using Herbs
name: The Complete Book of Herbs: A Practical Guide to Growing and Using Herbs
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2009
review_body: This book has so much information, I couldn't imagine not having it.  Each page or set of pages (depending on how much information) covers an herb or plant or flower, and it goes over myth and folklore of the plant, name meanings and origins, and varieties of the plant, as well as a sidebar that has the cultivation information (soil, sun exposure, growing tips and guides, harvesting and preserving) as well as possible uses (decorative, culinary, household, aromatic, medicinal, and cosmetic).On top of this, there's sections where the author goes in depth for planning an herb garden, basic all purpose small and large herb garden layouts and plants contained, patio, balcony, and indoor herb gardens, theme and aromatic gardens, the list goes on, with another ten or more.  Also included are smaller herb guides (herbs for flowers and foliage, salad herbs, herbal trees, etc), a guide to herbal decorations such as wreaths and hangings, garlands, herbal baskets and the like, herbs within the kitchen (soups, fish, meat, etc - just about anything you'd like to cook), herbs for the household (household products, dyes, papers, toys and trinkets, potpourri, etc), herbs for beauty, essential oils, herbs for health, cultivating and harvesting herbs...  Literally, there is so much information to be listed that I cannot summarize it all here.I find that this is definitely an indispensable volume, and it shows - my book has dozens of stickies in the tops of the pages, to mark everything I might want quick reference to (which, actually, doesn't work as well as I thought, since I have 7 levels of stickies...).The only drawback I can think of with this book is that it is not alphabetized in any way.  It makes it a bit of a pain to start, but the index does have an accurate guide (though it's in scientific names, not common ones).  I find, though, that this issue is easily overlooked, though, as this book is chalk full of information, and a book I won't easily get rid of!

brand: The Complete Book of Herbs: A Practical Guide to Growing and Using Herbs
name: The Complete Book of Herbs: A Practical Guide to Growing and Using Herbs
review_title: Best herb book I’ve ever seen
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2019
review_body: This book is wonderful written has beautiful color pages, has tons of information on a variety of herbs from start to finish. It has recipes in the back of the book from soups and stews to herbal teas and even beauty products you can make out of the plants. It has ways to show you different garden lay outs, just an all around fantastic book. If you’re into growing herbs this is the book to get. It tells you how to propagate all the way to how to grow use and dry your seeds. Wonderfully illustrated.

brand: The Complete Book of Herbs: A Practical Guide to Growing and Using Herbs
name: The Complete Book of Herbs: A Practical Guide to Growing and Using Herbs
review_title: Great book for learning to use herbs
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2016
review_body: This is a really great book about herbs.  About half of the book is an "herb index" with colored pictures and detailed information about various herbs.  This book focuses a lot on how to use herbs in everyday life.  There are tons of recipes, some for more common uses, like herbal soups and breads.  But there is a lot of information on less-common ways of utilizing herbs, like making herbal dyes, paper, potpourri, facial creams, and essential oils.  I haven't tried all of the recipes, so I cannot say for certain that they are all fabulous, but there is definitely plenty of information.This book has a 1988 copyright, and it does give off a little bit of an 80's vibe, but herbs haven't changed much in the last few decades, and the majority of the information is still useful.  While this book doesn't devote a great deal of time to actually growing herbs, it's a good book for learning how to actually use them.

brand: The Complete Book of Herbs: A Practical Guide to Growing and Using Herbs
name: The Complete Book of Herbs: A Practical Guide to Growing and Using Herbs
review_title: Wonderful full of great & Helpful prepper Tips
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2014
review_body: There are so many Herb books out their; if you could only get one this is it! I had seen this book at my Doctors office; in just the 10 minutes I was in the waiting room; I knew I had to have a copy! In this book there is anything from indoor/window/outdoor/patio/balcony herb gardens, Herbs in the Kitchen (With recipes included), Herbs for: dyes, toys, and potpourri. Herb for Beauty: skin care, skin cream/lotion recipes, herbal baths, soaps, hand, hair, eye, teeth care. Herbs for health: preparations, A-Z herb treatments. Cultivating & Harvesting: soil prep, propagation, maintaining plant shape. Growing herbs: in Container/ indoors. How to keeping herb plants healthy, Harvesting, and store/preserving them. (and much more!)Note: I have seen this book with a different cover picture; but everything is the same inside the book. I was able to get a hardcover copy in Good condition for under $7 (free shipping) so look around for the deals (for some reason the paper back copy was listed as $8 bucks more; strange right?) you won't be disappointed in this book!!! If I could give is 6 stars I would have!

There is nothing wrong with this product and I am very happy with my purchases and will buy it again in the future! I hope to make mochi, teas  cakes and other things with this.

review_body: This was way more then I expected. I felt like I was getting green thumb insider information. Like what times to focus on what plants and where certain plants have success. I never really thought to much about changes in temperature messing with my vegetables but of course I know about the different zones. Just a great overall read and not a light one at that. Highly recommended if you have some land in the Pacific North West region.

brand: Pacific Northwest Gardening Guide: TIPS TO GROW AND MAINTAIN 56 NATIVE & OTHER LOW-MAINTENANCE PLANTS, INVITE WELCOMED WILDLIFE AND GROW YOUR VEGETABLE GARDEN INTO A BEAUTIFUL BACKYARD OASIS

review_body: This book provides a comprehensive look at all things important to a PNW garden. One unusual aspect of this book includes a historical look at gardening here, very interesting. It also provides a comprehensive list of best flowers and vegetable to grow here, giving the beginning gardener a good advantage, as well as saving time and money! It also provides year-round advice, from planting to putting your garden to bed for the winter. Highly recommended!

review_title: Simple, concise and clear-- a blueprint for gardening in the Pacific Northwest.
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2023
review_body: It offers context, identifying gardeners and gardens  of note in both Canada and the US. The plant lists are attainable and focus on ecological benefits, while pleasing the human eye. This is a both a "starter" and a reference volume.

brand: Pacific Northwest Gardening Guide: TIPS TO GROW AND MAINTAIN 56 NATIVE & OTHER LOW-MAINTENANCE PLANTS, INVITE WELCOMED WILDLIFE AND GROW YOUR VEGETABLE GARDEN INTO A BEAUTIFUL BACKYARD OASIS

review_title: Very Interesting with a lot of resources
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2023
review_body: Easy to read book, logically structured. At the risk of repeating myself, the author has taken the gamble of using step-by-step instructions for each plant to make reading and applying techniques simple. For example, we find a straightforward structure of the chapters that deal with planting: planting guide, harvesting (if applicable), maintenance and care, and companion plants.We also found very interesting information about plants and gardening in the PNW, valuable insights about soil, tips, mistakes, management of pests and diseases, and many tips and tricks.As a newbie, some techniques could have been better illustrated and discussed. It is an excellent book for the initiated. Still, it remains challenging for beginners to apply.

brand: Pacific Northwest Gardening Guide: TIPS TO GROW AND MAINTAIN 56 NATIVE & OTHER LOW-MAINTENANCE PLANTS, INVITE WELCOMED WILDLIFE AND GROW YOUR VEGETABLE GARDEN INTO A BEAUTIFUL BACKYARD OASIS

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2023
review_body: If you live in the Pacific Northwest and you are wanting to start a garden, this is a great resource to help you get started. There are so many practical tips as well as step by step advice to help you get started on building a garden that makes the most out of the space that you have. Overall, this is well written and easy to understand, and I would recommend it for those who are interested in gardening or just interested in learning about the different types of flora that thrive in the region.

brand: The Art of Japanese Gardens: Designing & Making Your Own Peaceful Space
name: The Art of Japanese Gardens: Designing & Making Your Own Peaceful Space
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2014
review_body: this book enhances my collection of books on the subject and has given me several new ideas for my own garden.

brand: The Art of Japanese Gardens: Designing & Making Your Own Peaceful Space
name: The Art of Japanese Gardens: Designing & Making Your Own Peaceful Space
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2006
review_body: This book has some lovely photographs, but is very short on any real detail or practical information on making a japanese garden in your own home.  I found it much less useful than the Ortho book on Japanese Gardens.  I would not recommend it.  There are better books for appreciation and better practical guides.

brand: The Art of Japanese Gardens: Designing & Making Your Own Peaceful Space
name: The Art of Japanese Gardens: Designing & Making Your Own Peaceful Space
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2009
review_body: This book is not about Japanese gardens, whatever the title. I have read a lot of books about Japanese gardens but the content of this book is not in concordance with what other authors write about Japanese gardens.Foto 4-7 is referred to as a bright, flashy and colourfull Chinese-style gazebo in a cultivated Japanese garden. The foto though shows indeed a Chinese-style structure but the garden shows a two-tier fountain with a manneke-piss on top ....  in a Japanese garden?The foto's are nice but nowhere are there descriptions given of what it is or where it is.Then there are a lot of fotos of beautiful acers, but nowhere is there a connection to the text.And finally there are the drawings and the maps/designs. The drawings, to me, are basic but ok. The maps/designs are terrible: they are inconclusive and no time nor effort is put into it to make them at least look good or in any way professional.To me this book is an absolute waste of money.

brand: The Art of Japanese Gardens: Designing & Making Your Own Peaceful Space
name: The Art of Japanese Gardens: Designing & Making Your Own Peaceful Space
review_title: There is no how-to section on designing and making...
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2005
review_body: Take a peak at the excerpt provided. you will notice some acer palmatum japanese maples, in a section for cedar fences, for bamboo fences, fence railing. A back section for plant common and latin names. The are some very rough hand drawings no diagrams. Take a look at the index, look for the words "designing", "making", "creating", or "building".Coffee table book...get it.Sunset or Ortho type...don't.

brand: The Spice and Herb Bible
name: The Spice and Herb Bible
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2014
review_body: This large and beautiful book is divided into three parts. The first is a basic introduction to herbs and spices including a brief historical view, fairly common information about growing and harvesting herbs. The second actually examines individual spices. There are photographs of the plant and the spice as well as a guide to how to use them. Recipes are interspersed throughout. The last section involves the art of blending spices. Featured a number of bends, rubs and mixes and additional recipes. I found the first part rather bland.  I liked the second part. The text is uncomplicated and I appreciated the culinary information and the sidebars with the suggested amounts to be used with different foods. The third section was my favorite with many interesting blends. Some of them require many ingredients which can become costly.  This book is well done and sure to delight the home cook and arm chair gourmet alike.

brand: The Spice and Herb Bible
name: The Spice and Herb Bible
review_title: A great way to learn about spices
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2019
review_body: One way better than to learn recipes that contain spices is to actually learn how to use spices and what tastes they bring out with combined with certain foods. That way you can enhance your own foods... and even use less salt! Salt isn't the answer folks! This book is ❤️

review_body: The book itself is pretty interesting. Gives you plenty of info about each spice, from what it combines well with, to how to process and store, and alternate names, even some recipes that use the spice. Pretty much everything I wanted out of this.The only bad thing about this is that I definitely selected buy new, and this is not new. It has damage on all corners, a small tear in the spine, and stickers and stamps all over it that say it’s a discard from a library.Also, the back cover says this book sells for $49.95 USA for new, which is interesting, cause I paid $138 for used apparently from Amazon, so I’m definitely returning this

I appreciate that the bag closes to keep the air out. Thanks for a great product. I will order this and the Vietnamese cinnamon again.

brand: MODIFILAN 90 CAPS
name: MODIFILAN 90 CAPS
description: The powers of seaweeds have been drawn upon for centuries for their ability to prolong life, prevent disease, impart beauty and health. Worldwide research is continuously being done and brown seaweed has been found to be the most beneficial type. This product, MODIFILAN, is the purest, most natural nutritional supplement made from the brown seaweed Laminaria Japonica. Extract contains the life essential properties of Organic Iodine, Alginates, Fucoidan and Laminarin. Worldwide scientific studies and clinical research of these elements showed: *Organic Iodine feeds the Thyroid Gland, which controls metabolism and promotes maturation of the nervous system. Iodine is important for thyroid disorders, wherever underactive or overactive. *Alginate is a natural absorbent of radioactive elements, heavy metals and free radicals. It has the unique ability of binding heavy metals and radioactive elements to its own molecules. As the Alginate cannot be broken down by the bile or saliva and cannot be absorbed by the body, it is secreted from the body together with the heavy metals and radioactive substances. *Fucoidan causes certain types of rapidly growing cells to self-destruct. Promoting apoptosis, Fucoidan helps to naturally eliminate harmful cells from organism. *Laminarin is a polysaccharide helpful in the prevention and treatment of cardiovascular diseases. It exhibits 30% of the anticoagulant activity of heparin. These elements, treasured in brown seaweeds, are enhanced by patented cold-temperature extraction technology, which does not break their molecular structure. And MODIFILAN is not just another dry seaweed product - it is highly concentrated product. FORTY pounds of raw seaweed is needed to make ONE pound of MODIFILAN.
features: Boosts the immune system. | Detoxifies the body from heavy metals, radioactive elements, free radicals and toxins, and smokers from strontium and cadmium | Helps those who are overweight by improving the function of the gastro-intestinal tract. | Improves the structure of hair and nails and help them to grow. | Helps to decrease high blood sugar.
review_title: Great for detox and those with illnesses, such as cancer...
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2013
review_body: I researched many different alternative ways to help a family member who was shockingly diagnosed with non-hodgkins lymphoma, a blood cancer. (I must say that the power of prayer is first and foremost in my books, but for those who are not religious, put that comment aside please and read on.)I wanted to find products that could help could help clean the blood and boost the body's immune system. I read great things about seaweed and how those exposed to radiation were using it to detox their blood. I also found that it is hard to get "pure" seaweed because much of it is contaminated in the ocean. I trusted this product's web site for the safety of this product and bought the Modifilan. It mentioned that is contains Fucoidan which causes certain types of rapidly growing cancer cells to self-destruct. Promoting apoptosis (self-destruction of cancer cells), Fucoidan helps to naturally eliminate harmful cells from organism.It is expensive, but completely worth it. After only several months of taking this daily along with these other products, which I will list below, the cancer disappeared. It was a truly miracle to all of us and the doctors could not explain it, but I believe that these products greatly helped along with a change in diet (eliminate sugar and eat veggies). The other products that were taken in combination with this were, listed from most important to least taken were: Essiac, IP-6, Source Naturals Immune Defense (mushrooms), liquid chlorophyll, Krill oil,  Purple Defense, Momordica extract, Curcumin. Yes, I know it's a lot and you can never know for sure which one helped the most, but maybe the combination of them all did. I just wanted to list them so that others who might be in a similar situation, who are looking for cancer fighting products, can easily see what may work for them.

features: Boosts the immune system. | Detoxifies the body from heavy metals, radioactive elements, free radicals and toxins, and smokers from strontium and cadmium | Helps those who are overweight by improving the function of the gastro-intestinal tract. | Improves the structure of hair and nails and help them to grow. | Helps to decrease high blood sugar.
review_title: Very efficient at removing heavy metals
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2017
review_body: I have taken this off and on for years now. I was treated for Lyme disease late 2013 in Scottsdale.  Prior to going to AZ for treatment I had all of my mercury fillings removed and teeth fixed by an awesome dentist. I tested off the charts for both lead and mercury.  While undergoing IV treatment it included some chelation to lower my heavy metals.  By the end of my treatment I was tested again and they were lowered, but still higher than one wants. My Lyme doctor told me when I returned home to Texas I would need to continue chelation therapy. I bought an IV package, but it took 3 months before the home doctor re-tested me for heavy metals before we began chelation therapy.  During those 3 months I took 5-7 Modifilan daily just to help with my energy and I was low on iodine. Shockingly, when my chelation test came back after the 3 months of taking Modifilan my lead and mercury and other heavy metal levels were so low we did not have to do a single chelation treatment!!!  The 3 months of brown seaweed had pulled it out. I had read that it would, but did not know that it would do so efficiently! I always took it first thing in the morning on an empty stomach with a big glass of water due to the iodine. Side benefit it helped my BM's to be smoother and easier to pass.Update: June 8, 2018  I am still taking the Modifilian. When I run out I definitely  notice. Still love it. It still helps with my energy and I am assuming that it is still removing mercury. As your body detoxes heavy metals little by little more will dump from the cells. It is also still helping the bowels move normally.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2013
review_body: I was introduced to Modifilan 2 years ago.  Though I had had all the mercury fillings removed and replaced from my teeth, i had never chelated the residues from my system (30 yrs of mercury in my mouth).  I used Modifilan for about 45 days only.  Recently I did a heavy metal toxicity test, and the amount of mercury and lead were incredibly low in my system.I had recommended Modifilan to a patient of mine whose mercury levels were off the charts high.  After taking Modifilan for 2 months, his levels became completely low.Other patients have told me the increased energy levels from taking Modifilan.I think it's a great product and I use it every 6 months for a month as part of a detoxification/cleansing of my system.

review_body: I used to have great effects taking these - clear head and more energy but the last few bottles I didn't get the same effect anymore. The most recent bottles even gave me brain fog. Until there's clarification from the manufacturer, I'm not getting these anymore. And mine hasn't expired yet (it's 2019).

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2017
review_body: I have been taking this product for only 1 week now but I absolutely feel wonderful. I work in a vitamin store so I have tried a lot of supplements for energy and whatnot but this is by far the best. I had a ct scan about 4 months ago and had a shot of the contrast fluid. I had a "slight" allergic reaction to it including itchy throat, redness on chest and shortness of breath. 4 months later, I'm still short of breath. To my knowledge, this is due to the radiated iodine shot they gave me. The radiologist and GI doc said I would excrete it in my urine but that is definitely false. The radiologist ever freaked out when she saw I had a reaction and said, "this rarely happens! Let me get another doctor hold on." That doctor said, "I think she's having a reaction because she's so small." To which I said, "do you give the same amount to everyone?" He said YES 😲  I even went to urgent care to have a chest xray and everything came back normal and the doc said it was anxiety but I know what that feels like and this was different. After taking this product for a week, I can finally take deep breaths and I have a lot of energy.

review_body: I had some due to work (Nuclear Missiles Technician).Started taking.By itself, alone, no supplement will cause "revolutionary changes".  I am using some other natural stuff & common sense (e.g. limiting cellphone usage, no wireless/routers/wifi in my house, only eat organics)!One of the best heavy metals detox things on th emarket.Only problem - it is itself now exposed to Japanese, it's collected from Kuril Islands, Russia which is not far form Japan but don't worry, it's far enough.  I ran some calculations before buying.It makes me feel "lighter", more energetic but most important my hair's chemical analysis is now better.Note: human hair & blood is a standard method of heavy metals analysis.Ok I will go smoke now.

Worldwide scientific studies and clinical research of these elements showed: *Organic Iodine feeds the Thyroid Gland, which controls metabolism and promotes maturation of the nervous system. Iodine is important for thyroid disorders, wherever underactive or overactive. *Alginate is a natural absorbent of radioactive elements, heavy metals and free radicals. It has the unique ability of binding heavy metals and radioactive elements to its own molecules. As the Alginate cannot be broken down by the bile or saliva and cannot be absorbed by the body, it is secreted from the body together with the heavy metals and radioactive substances. *Fucoidan causes certain types of rapidly growing cells to self-destruct. Promoting apoptosis, Fucoidan helps to naturally eliminate harmful cells from organism. *Laminarin is a polysaccharide helpful in the prevention and treatment of cardiovascular diseases. It exhibits 30% of the anticoagulant activity of heparin. These elements, treasured in brown seaweeds, are enhanced by patented cold-temperature extraction technology, which does not break their molecular structure. And MODIFILAN is not just another dry seaweed product - it is highly concentrated product. FORTY pounds of raw seaweed is needed to make ONE pound of MODIFILAN.
features: Boosts the immune system. | Detoxifies the body from heavy metals, radioactive elements, free radicals and toxins, and smokers from strontium and cadmium | Helps those who are overweight by improving the function of the gastro-intestinal tract. | Improves the structure of hair and nails and help them to grow. | Helps to decrease high blood sugar.
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2013
review_body: I was taking Iodoral and it wasn't going so well. I switched to this after giving it a few days of no iodine. Almost immediately I was sleeping better (the iodine was keeping me awake), was more regular (again, the iodine was making me constipated), the puffiness under my eyes is diminishing, my stomach is flatter, I have lost 3 pounds, I have more energy, and my mood is better. I am always in a good mood, but I think this even kicked me up a notch. Not sure what is in this stuff, but as far as I am concerned, it's a keeper!I am taking 3 capsules daily with water.I've never had such immediate results with ANYTHING. It may seem exaggerated because I felt so bad on the Iodoral, but I really like this product.

review_title: Not sure if it should be taken or not
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2014
review_body: I've been researching natural supplements to help fight cancer and this supplement was at the top of the list and highly recommended.  I read every review here before I ordered it, unfortunately after I received it I read a review on WebMD about Modifilan that scared me and the bottle has remained unopened.  The person that wrote the review claimed they got Hashimoto's disease from taking Modifilan, she said it was incurable and regretted ever taking the supplement.  Does anyone have any information on this and can allay my fears about giving this supplement to a family member that is fighting cancer?  I have not added it to their protocol for fear of making their health worse but if it will help in any way then I want to add it.

features: Boosts the immune system. | Detoxifies the body from heavy metals, radioactive elements, free radicals and toxins, and smokers from strontium and cadmium | Helps those who are overweight by improving the function of the gastro-intestinal tract. | Improves the structure of hair and nails and help them to grow. | Helps to decrease high blood sugar.
review_title: I bought this product for help with energy and weight ...
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2017
review_body: I bought this product for help with energy and weight loss. Ive been taking it for about 2 weeks now and this product is the only thing different ive been doing. Amazingly it seems to be helping with....smoking. I usually smoke about 6-7 cigarettes a day and since taking this my urges went way down almost immediately. Im now down to 1-2 cigarettes a day. Nothing ive read says this product helps with smoking but it sure is doing something to help with my urges. Now i think about cigarettes and think nope just dont sound appealing. I Havent lost any weight yet but my appetite is down. Not quite sure about the energy, i do feel more focused though.Update 3/31/2017I don't seem to be benefiting from this at all. I'm not sure if it was a placebo affect that helped with the smoking or not. But it's been a month now and I see no difference in it, after the first week. I'd be willing to try it again just don't really want to spend money on something that shows no results. I'm on a strict low carb diet, I exercise and also take a 5htp supplement. Downgrading my rating from a 4 star to a 3. Sorry but not results. I'm trying to find something that helps with energy level and brain fog. Did not seem to help with that at all. However every body is different.

review_title: The results are are fairly good; I'm am on it now
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2018
review_body: I'v tried it a few times now. The results are are fairly good; I'm am on it now, here is what I feel- Very energetic, I am at work now, but would love to hit the gym.- I feel confident in being outspoken and engaging; even aggressively if need be, in any conversation with anyone regardless of their status.- It seems all the noise around me is toned down, however the noise pitch of people or music is much more intense.- I feel like writing, which I am actually doing writing this.- My anxiety and sense of under achievement is still prevalent, but to a much lesser extent than other days.- I am not hungry, and the thought of eating anything that is not culinary or nutritionally balanced seems discussing.Btw it says on the bottle "For maximum benefits, take 6 capsules in the morning with a full glass of water. Do they mean take them all at once ? has anyone tried that ?

features: EXTRA LARGE PACKET contains over 1 full ounce of pure live seeds (3,000+ seeds!) - Enough to cover 75 square feet. | THE FRESHEST SEEDS available lead to high germination rates, making your gardening easy, successful, and fun! | PREMIUM PACKAGING designed for optimal seed storage, with full planting instructions and reusable zipper - Great for gift giving! | GUARANTEED TO GROW! – We want everyone to be a successful gardener, and we’re always here with personal gardening advice. If you have any issue with our seeds, we’ll refund or replace them no questions asked! | ALL AROUND PERFECT garden flower provides a huge abundance of yellow and orange flowers that attract local pollinators, perform great as cut flowers, and have edible petals!
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2024
review_body: Every seed purchase I have bought from this company has been great. The quality germination and beauty are phenomenal.I tried to save money by going through dirt goddess for bulk seed calendula even though I have bought mine here great results.It was a mistake. I’m now stuck having to send back seed two times traveling 3 counties to return mislabeled wrong seed. The first time they sent a south East mix the second time corn a pound of dried corn seed labeled Calendula.Trust me don’t shop anywhere else for this seed trying to save money. Stick with what is tried and true. The flowers are beautiful and the germination is fabulous. No, mislabeled wrong products in shipping either.

But then in the past 2-4 weeks they have finally took off and I’m pleasantly surprised. I’m in Central NY. I planted them mid-June and they started flowering late August/early September. Next year I’ll try to plant in May for earlier blooms.

review_title: They grow up so fast! Like legit, a cm a day.
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2024
review_body: Planted these in a hospital window. With the sun on them they germinated and sprouted within three days. I was so surprised. Literally grow a cm a day it’s mind blowing.Mine need a lot of water, might be because of the sun shining on them all day. And I plant a lot of them… by accident, didn’t think all the seeds would sprout.It’s been over a month and they have not budded yet, though they are looking beautiful and are starting to have a lovely aroma!!Will update!

review_body: Excellent reading, especially as we are certified organic growers of botanicals, selling them to a distiller and attempting to learn more about herbs as we go. Originally I borrowed it from the local library, then realized it was a book we needed in our personal home library.

brand: MODIFILAN 90 CAPS
name: MODIFILAN 90 CAPS
description: The powers of seaweeds have been drawn upon for centuries for their ability to prolong life, prevent disease, impart beauty and health. Worldwide research is continuously being done and brown seaweed has been found to be the most beneficial type. This product, MODIFILAN, is the purest, most natural nutritional supplement made from the brown seaweed Laminaria Japonica. Extract contains the life essential properties of Organic Iodine, Alginates, Fucoidan and Laminarin. Worldwide scientific studies and clinical research of these elements showed: *Organic Iodine feeds the Thyroid Gland, which controls metabolism and promotes maturation of the nervous system. Iodine is important for thyroid disorders, wherever underactive or overactive. *Alginate is a natural absorbent of radioactive elements, heavy metals and free radicals. It has the unique ability of binding heavy metals and radioactive elements to its own molecules. As the Alginate cannot be broken down by the bile or saliva and cannot be absorbed by the body, it is secreted from the body together with the heavy metals and radioactive substances. *Fucoidan causes certain types of rapidly growing cells to self-destruct. Promoting apoptosis, Fucoidan helps to naturally eliminate harmful cells from organism. *Laminarin is a polysaccharide helpful in the prevention and treatment of cardiovascular diseases. It exhibits 30% of the anticoagulant activity of heparin. These elements, treasured in brown seaweeds, are enhanced by patented cold-temperature extraction technology, which does not break their molecular structure. And MODIFILAN is not just another dry seaweed product - it is highly concentrated product. FORTY pounds of raw seaweed is needed to make ONE pound of MODIFILAN.
features: Boosts the immune system. | Detoxifies the body from heavy metals, radioactive elements, free radicals and toxins, and smokers from strontium and cadmium | Helps those who are overweight by improving the function of the gastro-intestinal tract. | Improves the structure of hair and nails and help them to grow. | Helps to decrease high blood sugar.
review_title: Great for detox and those with illnesses, such as cancer...
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2013
review_body: I researched many different alternative ways to help a family member who was shockingly diagnosed with non-hodgkins lymphoma, a blood cancer. (I must say that the power of prayer is first and foremost in my books, but for those who are not religious, put that comment aside please and read on.)I wanted to find products that could help could help clean the blood and boost the body's immune system. I read great things about seaweed and how those exposed to radiation were using it to detox their blood. I also found that it is hard to get "pure" seaweed because much of it is contaminated in the ocean. I trusted this product's web site for the safety of this product and bought the Modifilan. It mentioned that is contains Fucoidan which causes certain types of rapidly growing cancer cells to self-destruct. Promoting apoptosis (self-destruction of cancer cells), Fucoidan helps to naturally eliminate harmful cells from organism.It is expensive, but completely worth it. After only several months of taking this daily along with these other products, which I will list below, the cancer disappeared. It was a truly miracle to all of us and the doctors could not explain it, but I believe that these products greatly helped along with a change in diet (eliminate sugar and eat veggies). The other products that were taken in combination with this were, listed from most important to least taken were: Essiac, IP-6, Source Naturals Immune Defense (mushrooms), liquid chlorophyll, Krill oil,  Purple Defense, Momordica extract, Curcumin. Yes, I know it's a lot and you can never know for sure which one helped the most, but maybe the combination of them all did. I just wanted to list them so that others who might be in a similar situation, who are looking for cancer fighting products, can easily see what may work for them.

review_title: Very efficient at removing heavy metals
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2017
review_body: I have taken this off and on for years now. I was treated for Lyme disease late 2013 in Scottsdale.  Prior to going to AZ for treatment I had all of my mercury fillings removed and teeth fixed by an awesome dentist. I tested off the charts for both lead and mercury.  While undergoing IV treatment it included some chelation to lower my heavy metals.  By the end of my treatment I was tested again and they were lowered, but still higher than one wants. My Lyme doctor told me when I returned home to Texas I would need to continue chelation therapy. I bought an IV package, but it took 3 months before the home doctor re-tested me for heavy metals before we began chelation therapy.  During those 3 months I took 5-7 Modifilan daily just to help with my energy and I was low on iodine. Shockingly, when my chelation test came back after the 3 months of taking Modifilan my lead and mercury and other heavy metal levels were so low we did not have to do a single chelation treatment!!!  The 3 months of brown seaweed had pulled it out. I had read that it would, but did not know that it would do so efficiently! I always took it first thing in the morning on an empty stomach with a big glass of water due to the iodine. Side benefit it helped my BM's to be smoother and easier to pass.Update: June 8, 2018  I am still taking the Modifilian. When I run out I definitely  notice. Still love it. It still helps with my energy and I am assuming that it is still removing mercury. As your body detoxes heavy metals little by little more will dump from the cells. It is also still helping the bowels move normally.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2013
review_body: I was introduced to Modifilan 2 years ago.  Though I had had all the mercury fillings removed and replaced from my teeth, i had never chelated the residues from my system (30 yrs of mercury in my mouth).  I used Modifilan for about 45 days only.  Recently I did a heavy metal toxicity test, and the amount of mercury and lead were incredibly low in my system.I had recommended Modifilan to a patient of mine whose mercury levels were off the charts high.  After taking Modifilan for 2 months, his levels became completely low.Other patients have told me the increased energy levels from taking Modifilan.I think it's a great product and I use it every 6 months for a month as part of a detoxification/cleansing of my system.

Until there's clarification from the manufacturer, I'm not getting these anymore. And mine hasn't expired yet (it's 2019).

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2017
review_body: I have been taking this product for only 1 week now but I absolutely feel wonderful. I work in a vitamin store so I have tried a lot of supplements for energy and whatnot but this is by far the best. I had a ct scan about 4 months ago and had a shot of the contrast fluid. I had a "slight" allergic reaction to it including itchy throat, redness on chest and shortness of breath. 4 months later, I'm still short of breath. To my knowledge, this is due to the radiated iodine shot they gave me. The radiologist and GI doc said I would excrete it in my urine but that is definitely false. The radiologist ever freaked out when she saw I had a reaction and said, "this rarely happens! Let me get another doctor hold on." That doctor said, "I think she's having a reaction because she's so small." To which I said, "do you give the same amount to everyone?" He said YES 😲  I even went to urgent care to have a chest xray and everything came back normal and the doc said it was anxiety but I know what that feels like and this was different. After taking this product for a week, I can finally take deep breaths and I have a lot of energy.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2011
review_body: I had some due to work (Nuclear Missiles Technician).Started taking.By itself, alone, no supplement will cause "revolutionary changes".  I am using some other natural stuff & common sense (e.g. limiting cellphone usage, no wireless/routers/wifi in my house, only eat organics)!One of the best heavy metals detox things on th emarket.Only problem - it is itself now exposed to Japanese, it's collected from Kuril Islands, Russia which is not far form Japan but don't worry, it's far enough.  I ran some calculations before buying.It makes me feel "lighter", more energetic but most important my hair's chemical analysis is now better.Note: human hair & blood is a standard method of heavy metals analysis.Ok I will go smoke now.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2013
review_body: I was taking Iodoral and it wasn't going so well. I switched to this after giving it a few days of no iodine. Almost immediately I was sleeping better (the iodine was keeping me awake), was more regular (again, the iodine was making me constipated), the puffiness under my eyes is diminishing, my stomach is flatter, I have lost 3 pounds, I have more energy, and my mood is better. I am always in a good mood, but I think this even kicked me up a notch. Not sure what is in this stuff, but as far as I am concerned, it's a keeper!I am taking 3 capsules daily with water.I've never had such immediate results with ANYTHING. It may seem exaggerated because I felt so bad on the Iodoral, but I really like this product.

review_title: Not sure if it should be taken or not
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2014
review_body: I've been researching natural supplements to help fight cancer and this supplement was at the top of the list and highly recommended.  I read every review here before I ordered it, unfortunately after I received it I read a review on WebMD about Modifilan that scared me and the bottle has remained unopened.  The person that wrote the review claimed they got Hashimoto's disease from taking Modifilan, she said it was incurable and regretted ever taking the supplement.  Does anyone have any information on this and can allay my fears about giving this supplement to a family member that is fighting cancer?  I have not added it to their protocol for fear of making their health worse but if it will help in any way then I want to add it.

review_title: I bought this product for help with energy and weight ...
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2017
review_body: I bought this product for help with energy and weight loss. Ive been taking it for about 2 weeks now and this product is the only thing different ive been doing. Amazingly it seems to be helping with....smoking. I usually smoke about 6-7 cigarettes a day and since taking this my urges went way down almost immediately. Im now down to 1-2 cigarettes a day. Nothing ive read says this product helps with smoking but it sure is doing something to help with my urges. Now i think about cigarettes and think nope just dont sound appealing. I Havent lost any weight yet but my appetite is down. Not quite sure about the energy, i do feel more focused though.Update 3/31/2017I don't seem to be benefiting from this at all. I'm not sure if it was a placebo affect that helped with the smoking or not. But it's been a month now and I see no difference in it, after the first week. I'd be willing to try it again just don't really want to spend money on something that shows no results. I'm on a strict low carb diet, I exercise and also take a 5htp supplement. Downgrading my rating from a 4 star to a 3. Sorry but not results. I'm trying to find something that helps with energy level and brain fog. Did not seem to help with that at all. However every body is different.

As the Alginate cannot be broken down by the bile or saliva and cannot be absorbed by the body, it is secreted from the body together with the heavy metals and radioactive substances. *Fucoidan causes certain types of rapidly growing cells to self-destruct. Promoting apoptosis, Fucoidan helps to naturally eliminate harmful cells from organism. *Laminarin is a polysaccharide helpful in the prevention and treatment of cardiovascular diseases. It exhibits 30% of the anticoagulant activity of heparin. These elements, treasured in brown seaweeds, are enhanced by patented cold-temperature extraction technology, which does not break their molecular structure. And MODIFILAN is not just another dry seaweed product - it is highly concentrated product. FORTY pounds of raw seaweed is needed to make ONE pound of MODIFILAN.
features: Boosts the immune system. | Detoxifies the body from heavy metals, radioactive elements, free radicals and toxins, and smokers from strontium and cadmium | Helps those who are overweight by improving the function of the gastro-intestinal tract. | Improves the structure of hair and nails and help them to grow. | Helps to decrease high blood sugar.
review_title: The results are are fairly good; I'm am on it now
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2018
review_body: I'v tried it a few times now. The results are are fairly good; I'm am on it now, here is what I feel- Very energetic, I am at work now, but would love to hit the gym.- I feel confident in being outspoken and engaging; even aggressively if need be, in any conversation with anyone regardless of their status.- It seems all the noise around me is toned down, however the noise pitch of people or music is much more intense.- I feel like writing, which I am actually doing writing this.- My anxiety and sense of under achievement is still prevalent, but to a much lesser extent than other days.- I am not hungry, and the thought of eating anything that is not culinary or nutritionally balanced seems discussing.Btw it says on the bottle "For maximum benefits, take 6 capsules in the morning with a full glass of water. Do they mean take them all at once ? has anyone tried that ?

When mixed with mayo, it makes an awesome sandwich spread. Toss it with pasta for a quick meal

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2021
review_body: Colorful with easy to find information. Needed more than generic basics. It's good that the Beets section gives Costal/Sound info. vs interior. Needed this sort of detail for every section. Need help with huge factors like wind, rain, soil. These  differ dramatically by location.  Ex. NW Washington  vs SW Oregon. Needed help with chili Anacortes summers.  It's crazy winds and soil. We don't get much help from a county extension office.

review_title: A very good book for beginner and more advanced "herb learner"
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2015
review_body: Excellent reading, especially as we are certified organic growers of botanicals, selling them to a distiller and attempting to learn more about herbs as we go.  This was all about the basics, but it did cover scientific names, medicinal, culinary, and cosmetic uses.  Originally I borrowed it from the local library, then realized it was a book we needed in our personal home library.

brand: Pacific Foods
name: Pacific Foods Beef Broth, 32 oz (Pack of 12)
description: Experience layers of nourishing flavor with Pacific Foods Beef Broth. We slow-simmer beef with garlic and sea salt for a savory beef broth that's rich and full of flavor. Sip a cup of warm beef broth instead of coffee or tea for a delicious, satisfying addition to your everyday routine. It's great for refueling after workouts, beating the afternoon doldrums or relaxing in the evening. Just pour, heat and enjoy! For an even better sipping experience, add a slice of lemon, ginger or some fresh herbs to your gluten free broth. Each 1-cup serving of Pacific Foods Broth contains less than 1 gram of carbs and 20 calories. One 32 oz recyclable carton contains roughly 4 servings. In addition to drinking it as a traditional sipping broth, you can use this broth in any recipe that calls for beef stock, broth or water, such as homemade soups. Try it as a soup base or to cook grains, potatoes and veggies. Pacific Foods also offers unsalted chicken broth and vegetable broth. At Pacific Foods, we're dedicated to making the most nourishing foods possible from simple, carefully sourced ingredients.
features: Slow simmered broth captures the full meaty flavor of beef that is seasoned with garlic and sea salt | Use as a base for soups, risottos and pasta dishes | Fat-free and gluten-free, high quality ingredients | Convenient resealable, twist open carton | Refrigerate after opening and use within 7 to 10 days | Keto Friendly

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2024
review_body: It's Beef Broth and yes there's a difference. Some Beef Broth is really a vege broth with beef and no so much of beef at all. This broth ticks all the boxes, I use it instead of water for ramen and or Asian noodle meals, also Mexican ramen. They taste much better and you can choose if you want to add the "spice" powder or not which is mainly hot chili powder and sodium, you can add your own chili sauce, skip the sodium and have a much better meal. I've bought organic Beef Bone Broth but it's a waste of money, costs twice as much as this broth and isn't as beefy. So I say give this broth a try, be sure of what you're buying since this brand also makes a "beef broth" that is the same as I mentioned above, I want beef and nothing but the beef.

brand: Frontier Co-op
name: Frontier Co-op Organic Ground Ginger Root 4.09oz
features: GROUND GINGER ROOT - Frontier Co-op Ground Ginger Root (Zingiber officinale) is a rhizome, and has been an important spice for over 3,000 years. Ginger root is a staple in Asian and Indian cuisines, often used to give foods a spicy, aromatic flavor. Enjoyed in cuisines the world over for its warm, spicy-sweet aroma and flavor, ginger complements both sweet and savory dishes. | GROUND GINGER ROOT - Frontier Co-op Ground Ginger Root (Zingiber officinale) is a rhizome, and has been an important spice for over 3,000 years. Ginger root is a staple in Asian and Indian cuisines, often used to give foods a spicy, aromatic flavor. Enjoyed in cuisines the world over for its warm, spicy-sweet aroma and flavor, ginger complements both sweet and savory dishes. | VERSATILE USES - This lovely off-white to light brown spice is ground from the dried ginger root making it convenient for baked foods, curries and chutneys and for sprinkling on applesauce and other cooked fruit and vegetable dishes. Ginger also lends its hot, spicy flavor to condiments, relishes, sauces, stir-fries, pickles, beverages, candies and all types of desserts. | IMPORTED AND ORGANIC - Our ginger root is grown and processed in Peru, China, India, and Sri Lanka. There are no artificial additives or chemicals used at any stage of growing, harvesting and manufacturing. | RESEALABLE - Try the premium quality Frontier Co-op herbs and culinary seasonings in convenient, reclosable packaging. Our stand-up bags are made to keep our products as fresh on the last day as they are on the first. Just scoop and reseal to lock in the freshness. These bags are resealable, sturdy, and great for easy storage and easy access. For best results, store in a cool, dry place. | ABOUT US - Owned by stores and organizations that buy and sell our products, Frontier Co-op has been a member-owned cooperative since 1976. We support natural living and our products are never irradiated or treated with ETO (Ethylene Oxide). We’re committed to the health and welfare of the environment and everyone producing and consuming our botanical products.
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2024
review_body: I love this Organic Ginger Root Powder It is very fragrant & has a strong & smooth ginger taste/good potency. It’s packaged well in a seal pouch. Ginger has many health benefits and is great for digestive health.  I use a lot of ginger in my cooking as well as making tea.  This is a very good purchase as it is Organic, Potent & a large quantity which can last me a while.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2023
review_body: My wife and I are lifelong gardeners and we have a whole array of beds for everything from perennials to annuals, bulbs, herbs and vegetables.We agreed to review this set through the Vine program and we are reviewing these now, because a review at the end of the season doesn't seem as though it will help gardeners who are ordering their supplies right now. So, we're reviewing this set based on our veteran "eye" as gardeners.First, we like the array of seeds and they're perfect for a big raised bed we plant fresh each year with seeds.Then, we're also aware that most gardeners, ourselves included, would prefer to buy our seeds either from our favorite garden stores or from our gardening catalogues, selecting each packet of seeds individually. So, the main benefit of this offering is that it's priced quite reasonably. You're getting a dozen packets of seeds here at quite a reduced price, compared with the cost of selecting individual packets.Finally, if you are considering ordering this set, please read more about each variety. Veteran gardeners will recognize right away that this is a set that mixes annuals and perennials. For example, in our experience, dill tends to be an annual, although there are biennial varieties. But planting lavender will start a perennial patch, if you take care of your garden. You'll want to learn about these plants before you place them.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2023
review_body: This set is a great price for the amount of variety you get and the fact that these seeds are USDA certified organic. The organic seeds at my local nursery cost twice as much per packet. I’m excited to start these seeds in about a month, but it’s nice knowing that they will be good for at least another year according to the date stamped across the back.I’ve never grown tea varieties before but I know I’ll definitely consume the chamomile and mint as tea and use the basil for savory dishes. The remaining varieties I’ll plant as ornamentals for their fragrance. I wasn’t expecting to receive everything in a nice resealable pouch, but it looks pretty and giftable. If most of the seeds germinate then I may buy this set for my gardener friends too!

brand: The Complete Medicinal Herbal: A Practical Guide to the Healing Properties of Herbs, with More Than 250 Remedies for Common Ailments
name: The Complete Medicinal Herbal: A Practical Guide to the Healing Properties of Herbs, with More Than 250 Remedies for Common Ailments
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2010
review_body: **Note:  My review is based on the Australian version of this book. "The Complete Guide Medicinal Herbal By Penelope Ody - An A-Z of over 120 medicinal herbs for all Australians."***This is my favourite beginner's book. Not because it is basic, as it is not but because of its easy page -per-herb layout. Although there is terminology that may yet be foreign to the beginner the wording used throughout this publication is easy to follow and very personable.Leading with an historic introduction Penelopy Ody gives the reader some background into the origins of herbal medicine. Each herb is discussed in terms of its historical background, parts used and applications. There are full-colour photographs to help the reader identify various parts of each plant. This book does not contain some of the herbs you might find in Mrs Grieve's A Modern Herbal but it is a more than adequate source of information particularly for the home user. Unlike some other herbals, Ms Ody includes small sections dedicated to the lesser known herbal lore of Ayurvedic Herbs out of India, Australian bush herbs, South American rainforest remedies and even some types of funghi .Approximately two thirds of the book is herb lore, the remaining third shows the reader what to do with this newly acquired knowledge. Using easy to follow photographs the author takes the reader from harvesting and drying to the techniques involved in making the various remedies. There are basic formulas which can be adapted to many recipes. Charmingly, although the quantities given are standardised, the measurements are provided in metric as well as kitchen utensil equivalent. For example, 62.5mls is given to equal 1 sherry glass whereas 150mls is the same as one tea cup. The section on home remedies goes into the nitty gritty of treating common ailments, suggesting combinations of herbs appropriate for each condition and cautioning the use of some herbs in certain situations.It is fabulous to see a herbal that addresses some issues unique to Australia, includes some of our native bush remedies, is written in non US English and most importantly it contains a comprehensive list of Australian and New Zealand address list of organisations and practitioners.Now the bad news, I have looked high and low to find copies of this book. There are some used copies available on Amazon but I can't find new ones. They may be out there, but even the publishers' website does not feature it in their search engine. Before you howl with disappointment though, there are other versions of the same book. I ended up buying the American version which is almost identical. I have noticed a few exclusions in the herb department, such as Khella and Galangal but then the use of Khella is restricted in Australia anyway. There are over 130 herbs in this version probably based on the use of Native American remedies in the US. Of course there are not the lists of Australian/NZ contacts that I mentioned.

brand: The Complete Medicinal Herbal: A Practical Guide to the Healing Properties of Herbs, with More Than 250 Remedies for Common Ailments
name: The Complete Medicinal Herbal: A Practical Guide to the Healing Properties of Herbs, with More Than 250 Remedies for Common Ailments
review_title: A Must Have For Every Family
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2011
review_body: Oh I was so excited to get this! I had heard so much about The Complete Medicinal Herbal by Penelope Ody that I had to order it for myself. This amazing book is a library in itself! Filled with beautiful color photographs of all the herbal plants and their parts so you can easily identify plants;along with the uses of each part of the plant;how to make tonics;the history of herbal medicines;making essential oils;making poultices,creams and so much more!You'll find more than 250 remedies for common ailments;and how to make a herbal first aid kit!This really is the bible of herbal medicine!Once thought to be considered a sign of those who practiced witchcraft,more and more of those in the professional field of healing are turning back to once again using medicinal herbs. A skill highly regarded in the Eastern cultures,medicinal herbs have continued to grow in popularity since the 1960's here in the US.I don't think you'll find anyone more knowledgeable in herbal medicines than Penelope Ody who has studied in China and England and practices as a professional medical herbalist in England and writes for several publications on the subject.I highly recommend this book for your home library or preparedness library. It's a necessity for all of us who desire to be prepared for any emergency. Learn to identify the best plants and which plants to grow in your garden to have on hand for your family's specific needs. This is a treasure!

brand: The Complete Medicinal Herbal: A Practical Guide to the Healing Properties of Herbs, with More Than 250 Remedies for Common Ailments
name: The Complete Medicinal Herbal: A Practical Guide to the Healing Properties of Herbs, with More Than 250 Remedies for Common Ailments
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2019
review_body: There are many books out there on herbalism . This one is another one and maybe like all the others yet with some differences . This one is great for the coffee table, it is big, hardcover and looks nice. Most books on herbology will give you a dictionary listing of the herbs and what they are good for. The second half of most books has the dictionary symptom of ailments and what herbs can be used to treat them. This book has more.The first part of the book talks about different philosophies around herbs. The author discusses Chinese medicine, Ayurvedic medicine, Greek medicine , European medicine going up until today. This tome will teach the student how to prepare teas, oil infusions and tinctures. There is a section on how to grow and harvest your herbs as well.When describing the herbs you get a full page based on that herb. There is a picture of the herb and all the parts that are used. There is also a subsection on the page dealing  applications . The various ailment that plague us are listed in chart form. So you get the ailment, what herb you should use and how the herb should be prepared. It is easy to understand .

brand: Pacific Northwest Foraging for Beginners: A 3 Step Self-Sufficient System for Identifying, Harvesting, and Preparing Edible Wild Foods. A Foraging Field Guide.
name: Pacific Northwest Foraging for Beginners: A 3 Step Self-Sufficient System for Identifying, Harvesting, and Preparing Edible Wild Foods. A Foraging Field Guide.
review_title: Perfect book for the novice forager
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2021
review_body: Though I haven’t foraged in night on to 70 years, this book has ignited a spark to once again head for the hills, or at least the flats, and see what can be found. This book is easy to read and understand. Mr. Macy uses actual photos of the plants and fine drawings. I would not hesitate to take his book and forage.I did find the recipes at the end difficult to read, as the brown seemed to bleed into the white letters, but not impossible. And I would have liked, since this is a book on the Pacific Northwest to have seen a few more plants mentioned, e.g., Chamomile, Devil’s Club, Fir Trees, Russian Olive, Miner’s Lettuce, and one found in Eastern Oregon and Washington, Datura. I don’t think we have enough Pine Trees to make them worth the mention, though I could be wrong.I appreciated how Mr. Mace stressed sustainable harvesting, not just when to harvest, but how. I thought his ideas on cooking, serving, or saving/preserving were quite well done and appreciated. I would add one more item to my foraging kit: brand name hand sanitizer. I’ve found it works well on bites and blisters to cut the sting and burn, as well as cleaning hands.If you’ve ever considered foraging for food, fun, or profit, this is the book for you. Nicely done.

brand: Pacific Northwest Foraging for Beginners: A 3 Step Self-Sufficient System for Identifying, Harvesting, and Preparing Edible Wild Foods. A Foraging Field Guide.
name: Pacific Northwest Foraging for Beginners: A 3 Step Self-Sufficient System for Identifying, Harvesting, and Preparing Edible Wild Foods. A Foraging Field Guide.
review_title: This book should be in every forager's pack
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2021
review_body: I highly recommend this book to anyone who plans to forage in the PNW. Whether you're a novice or an expert, there is so much helpful information in here to optimize your foraging journey. Not only does it cover some of the most useful, tasty wild edible and medicinal plants to be found in the region, but it also teaches foragers what to look out for in terms of poisonous lookalikes, making identification much easier.One thing I REALLY love about this book is the information on ethical harvesting. So, not only can you go out into the wild and find what you're looking for, but you also learn how to help these plants continue growing so others can enjoy them, too. It is incredibly well-written and makes for a fast, easy-to-digest read and guides people in the preparation and preservation of their harvests. It's truly an invaluable resource to the PNW forager that will thumbed through over and over again.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2021
review_body: This book is amazing! A great read! Extremely educational for beginners as well as seasoned foragers. Weather your just staring out or have been foraging for years. There is always something new to learn and the descriptions accompanied with the photos are seriously helpful. I have to say my favorite part though would have to be the chapter on remembering to take the time and build a relationship with the Trails and nature. To make sure you thank the plants for what they are providing you with, as well not over harvesting so that you may return in the future to the beautiful places. Truly inspiring while making you just want to head on out on the next foraging adventure.Thank you 🤗

brand: Pacific Northwest Foraging for Beginners: A 3 Step Self-Sufficient System for Identifying, Harvesting, and Preparing Edible Wild Foods. A Foraging Field Guide.

review_title: Easy to read foraging field guide
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2021
review_body: This book is an in depth guide and is well put together. It offers perspective in respect to our connection to nature and our responsibility to our planet and it's care. Paul Macy gives the reader insights into the plants habitat, how to identify them, where and when to gather, which parts are edible, and how to gather. This book provides preparation techniques and several edible plant recipes. A seasonal harvesting calendar is also included. It’s a must read for beginner foragers.

review_title: Didn't work for my bladder pain, unfortunately.
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2024
review_body: I have interstitial cystitis and am currently taking Oxybutynin ER for the bladder spasms and to lessen the amount of times I have to go to the bathroom.  But I still have the pain.  I have done a lot of research on different supplements and medications that might help with the bladder pain and I came across this.  I took the entire bottle per the labels instructions, but I never noticed my pain subsiding. I don't want to rate it poorly and potentially deter someone else from trying it. bc wWe are all different and our bodies are different and what may not help me, could have the potential to greatly help someone else.  It's also possible that it may take more than 1 bottle before I start to notice any results; but my Dr asked me to stop taking these while I began the Oxybutynin ER, so I didn't purchase another bottle.

review_title: Works great for sleep and mild anxiety
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2015
review_body: I researched California Poppy in regard to anxiety and trouble sleeping. I was prescribed a mild dose of Xanax to help because I have reoccurring stress dreams all night long that prevent me from getting good sleep. I wasn't comfortable with that so I started checking around and found this. I have been using it for only 1 week but I really notice a difference. I haven't taken the anti anxiety med or melatonin (another failed attempt) and I feel pretty good. I track my sleep with a Jawbone device and this has added at least 2 additional hours of solid sleep to my night. The dreams are lucid but not too crazy and it's a nice break from the usual 'I'm behind on this and it needs to be done now!' dreams. I don't wake up groggy and I can use it throughout the day for general anxiety and It doesn't  do anything but take the edge off. I don't even notice that part, I just realize at the end of the day the job seamed easier. I gave some to my husband to try and he had a crazy dream that left him rattled, so it's probably not for everyone but for me it works.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2017
review_body: I have used this as sleep enhancing remedy for several months and find it quite effective. I tried Californai Poppy capsules and they do not do the job. I take one dropper full  of this extract in a cup of chamomile tea about an hour before sleep. Straight chamomile does nothing. The poppy  seems to help me wake up on time and be more alert, not over sleep, so it may be helping the quality of  sleep. I dislike the high alcohol level and the taste is truly vile, that is the reason for four stars. Herb Pharm has proved to be a reliable company of quality extracts but they don't make California Poppy in a glycerin, non alcohol form. I still recommend this and suggest putting it in an herb tea to avoid the taste.

features: Expertly extracted to provide calming support to the nervous system | Prepared from certified organic, fresh whole Eschschoizia californica plants grown on our own southern Oregon farms | Gluten-free and non-GMO | Gentle enough to use with children | Herb potency assured through High Performance Thin Layer Chromatography (HPTLC) analysis
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2016
review_body: I have a very high tolerance for benzodiazepines from years of being prescribed for insomnia, so I researched my problem and landed on studies of  Eschscholzia californica.  As others have stated in the reviews here - every person is unique, and no two people will experience the same effects.  With this in mind I read all the reviews and saw that people either had a good result or very little result and thought I'd try it for my severe chronic insomnia and see if it helped me.  After laying awake for 4 hours I took it (exactly as the label instructs) at 2:45am.  When I was still awake an hour later and got up to use the bathroom I was very startled to find I suddenly had severe double vision and a really unpleasant sensation in the front of my head.  After returning to bed I essentially blacked out for about 45 minutes and then snapped wide awake (where I stayed the rest of the night).  Fortunately for me the double vision passed in about 3 more hours.  I spent the next day with a headache and the realization that supplements like this are completely unregulated and I had NO IDEA what I had actually consumed when I took this product. The ingredients indicated on the label are "Alcohol 62%" and distilled water.  Perhaps it's wood alcohol? That might explain the bad visual disturbance and unpleasant headache.  I'm thankful my vision returned to normal the next day, as I could've experienced permanent damage from consuming a liquid made and sold by an unknown entity in an industry that has zero oversight.  Final word on this stuff: take at your own risk.  If the severe visual disturbance I experienced from it hadn't passed... I hate to imagine.  And 45 minutes of sleep for the night wasn't my goal. I threw the bottle in the trash the next day.  THINK TWICE ABOUT WHAT YOU MIGHT BE CONSUMING BEFORE TAKING THIS PRODUCT.

I switched over to the California Poppy after doing some reading - I had fantastic results right away. It is a bit strong on it's own as far as flavor. I have not used it for pain as of yet - just sleep. My Son was using Melatonin and I asked him to try this. He also said his sleep was deeper with CA Poppy and he did not feel groggy the next day. Also his anxiety has calmed down as well. I would recommend this for anyone  looking for better sleep and something to give a relaxing state, not for pain relief.

review_title: "California here I come right back wher I started from"
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2015
review_body: I picked this product because the  California Poppy is my favorite flower and I never knew that I could ingest them.  I grew up with them growing prolifically in our back yard in northern California.  If I knew then what I know now, I would have a  a real great buildup in my system and may have never needed tranquilizers. I take two droppers half full in a glass of liquid before I go to bed and  I can say that i am no longer taking ZQuil., at least..  This seems to be a much more effectual sleep aid.  I cannot say, like the other reviewers, that I wanted a mystical experience or to get "high' on this product.  I am already a "heavy dreamer". I just want to stop taking chemicals to get me to sleep which is VERY DIFFICULT.  I am going to continue to buy this product.

features: California Poppy seed
review_title: Works!  Must have at all times...
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2018
review_body: I first heard of California Poppy for pain in 2012 when a segment on Dr. Oz discussed this item.  But it was hard to find ... and the stores only had it in liquid tincture form.  (Yuck!)  Forgot about the product for years, until I saw this during a LIGHTENING DEAL ... so I grabbed a bottle.  After consulting with my pain doc, I upped the dose.  2 at bedtime, 1 or 2 in the A.M., and 1 or 2 in the late afternoon.  They are NOT a miracle.  They have become an important part of my pain treatment plan.  Give them a good trial by using them on schedule,  for the whole first bottle.  Honestly, I panic if my supply is low.  As, far as dosage, start on a Friday night and see if they make you drowsy during the day on Saturday and Sunday ... Add a day dose during the next weekend.  I have no day drowsiness, yet they help me fall asleep faster, along with melatonin.  Most allopathic Doctors know nothing about California Poppyseed supplements.  They are NOT like a drugs related to poppy flowers (heroin).  They have not shown up during urine drug testing at work.

I should listen to my own advice more and will because this isn't returnable nor refundable that's a big chunk  of change I don't anymore.  So read small print and order BROAD SPECTRUM CBD.  Let Dorothy keep the poppies.

brand: California Poppy Tea Herb Organic 4 Ounce
name: California Poppy Tea Herb Organic 4 Ounce
description: This listing is for 1 - 4 ounce package of Organic California Poppy Herb. California Poppy Herb, or Eschscholzia californica, consists of the parts of the plant that grow above the ground, i.e., the leaves, stems and petals. These bulk herbs (which are really leaves and petals) are then dried and can be used as an infusion (as in tea) or an herbal tincture. A perennial native to the interior valleys of southern Oregon and California and ranging into the deserts of Nevada and Arizona, bulk California Poppy Herb has been used for several thousands of years by the Yokut and Pima Indians for its mildly sedative properties. Warning: Not to be used during pregnancy.

review_body: I wanted to start to experiment with more natural methods of pain control. I am just starting to use this tea. I don’t know how well it works yet, but it has a pleasant taste and seems of high quality. I think the people who own this farm present a quality product, curated with a lot of love. The packaging was charming and a coupon for further purchases was included. I think that this tea, along with some empty tea bags, would make a fine and thoughtful gift.

brand: Nelson's Tea - California Poppy - Cut & Sifted - Loose Leaf - Herbal Tea - 2oz
name: Nelson's Tea - California Poppy - Cut & Sifted - Loose Leaf - Herbal Tea - 2oz
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2023
review_body: I love plant allies and how they can help us move through things. California poppy can soothe your nervous system. In the wake of a challenging situation, my emotions today were very weighty. I feel sad most of the day, and used the poppy tea for the first time this evening. I feel calm, gentle and at peace. Even a little fuzzy, which is not a great description for some people but it explains how I feel. The taste is somewhat grassy, and almost has a warm mouth feel (not like licorice root, way more subtle). I enjoyed it, and I’m enjoying the relaxing feeling of it now.
