review_title: Not a loose leaf tea: see the difference on the photos leaf vs no leaf
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2023
review_body: This is not a "loose leaf tea" as advertised but pieces of stems without a single leaf or flower.  I enclosed a photo of my old loose leaf ( almost finished) tea beside what I received from Nelson.  You can see for yourself.  Despite the evidence, the seller denied the deceitful advertisement and denied my returning his loose stems ( for obvious reason).  When a seller denies a return, the seller does not refund.  Amazon did reimburse me with their A to Z policy.  Be aware of this and try finding a real loose leaf tea of California Poppy.  It's a wonderful tea when the leaves are there.

Just send me a little bit more of the thing I actually wanted to get from you, instead of a massive sample of something else. That’s my hot take.

Sometimes it makes me feel sleepy and I yawn but other times it just knocks me out and so I only take it a little before bedtime. This is a sedative so use with caution. And consult with your doctor before taking. I got this because it said it would help with early morning awakenings. At least that is what the magazine article said. name: California Poppy Alcohol-Free Liquid Extract, Organic California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) Dried Above-Ground Part Glycerite Hawaii Pharm Natural Herbal Supplement 2 oz
description: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather.

review_title: Can cause the exact symptoms you're trying to quell
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2023
review_body: At first, I thought this product was working well. California poppy activates the GABA receptors in the brain. GABA helps to calm the body and the mind, and counterbalances the neurotransmitter called “glutamate” which excites the body's central and peripheral nervous systems.However, too much GABA can cause the exact symptoms you are trying to prevent! This is what happened to me after 4 nights of taking 1ml of this product at night. I experienced anxiety (with a tight chest), restlessness, and slight shortness of breath. At first, I thought the symptoms I was trying to fix were just getting worse, so I increased my dose a little bit, but my symptoms got worse. This is when I realised the product was making me feel worse.Be mindful of your dosage and keep track your symptoms. If you don’t feel any better, maybe you are too sensitive and you’re increasing GABA too much like I experienced.I know the product caused this feeling because I’ve taken GABA powder in the past and felt the exact same thing when I no longer required it my body started reacting badly.

review_title: Seems to help about half the time, if taken when needed. May be a dose issue?
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2023
review_body: I tried this for as-needed calming (rather than taking daily). First try: I was wired (brain rushing for no clear reason) and one capsule did help me relax in about 30 minutes, but it was right after a hot shower, which is also calming.Second time I tried this I was agitated and stressed. It helped, but not quickly. Two hours later I was depressed, but I doubt it had anything to do with the supplement. Likely just an off day for me.Third try, I took this around 5 pm for agitation. It helped a little bit, but slowly. However, I slept very well that night, better than expected.Poppy is believed to act on GABA receptors, which calm your central nervous system. Research is limited on California Poppy, but 250 mg (one of these capsules) might be a low dose. I’m not recommending you take more but, if results are lacking, dosage may be the reason. Similar products on Amazon are 600-800 mg per serving.Sleep is complex. California poppy will likely not help if your sleep issues are caused by liver or blood sugar problems. It may help if you’re too wound up to sleep.

brand: Best Naturals California Poppy 1000 mg Equivalent - 60 Capsules

Sodium Free.
review_title: Feel benefits to relaxing for sleep.
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2023
review_body: This was the first California Poppy supplement I took.  I am coming close to attributing this as assuredly contributing but I  can't necessarily attribute just this as I've been taking several sleep aids off and on.  No side effects.  A couple of the other multi ingredient sleep aids also include less California Poppy and when using those I don't take this.  In general my goal has been more and better sleep and I'm finding that from a couple mixed ingredient sleep aids now so I'm not experimenting with this supplement much now that I've found the others.  Will probably experiment more with it later and update.Pros:I feel more calm and am getting better quality of sleep for what little I usually get.Value for 60days under $10.ConsNone noted.ABOUT ME AND SUPPLEMENTS:Supplements are sometimes easy to attribute a positive or negative though mostly they aren't attributable over months if ever.  I will try my best to review on what I see if I do and update if I find a change.  Supplements I'm generally not overjoyed with or that I have faith in the quality of as well as how economical they are to continue - I will not take past the bottle I'm using and thus won't update unless I revisit this not likely any time soon.I have been taking numerous supplements for decades and several more for many years.  Lately I have started some new supplements mixing in with existing.  I favor simple supplements with one or a few active ingredients that way I can decide how much of what I am taking.  In general supplements with tons of ingredients and especially ones that are aimed at one thing yet contain numerous supplements with little to no added benefits are worrisome.  I do not need (for example) to worry about getting 100 or 400 (whatever) each times the B vitamins needed in a day from five or ten or more different supplements.In experimenting I am usually taking for days or weeks some supplements then switching for a different brands equivalent noting differences if any.  Some I don't have an alternative and will use the entire amount without other brands in the mix.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2023
review_body: I was looking for something all natural for anxiety and sleep other than melatonin and kava kava. I was intrigued to try the California Poppy supplement as I've never considered it before.It arrived sealed and I checked the expiration date and it had a good year and a half or so before expiration.I used it for a week straight just at bedtime. It seemed to work most of the time. Then I decided to try one on a Saturday morning around 10am to see how it helped with anxiety. It didn't seem to have much of an effect,if any. However, that's not to say they won't work for someone else. I did continue to use it AM and PM for a couple of weeks and for me, it doesn't seem to have much of an effect during the daytime that I could tell. But for sleep, it helped most of the time.

brand: California Poppy Alcohol-Free Liquid Extract, Organic California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) Dried Above-Ground Part Glycerite 4 oz
name: California Poppy Alcohol-Free Liquid Extract, Organic California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) Dried Above-Ground Part Glycerite 4 oz
description: The California poppy is the state flower of California, a tender perennial plant bearing blue-green leaves and 2 to 4 inch (5 to 10 cm) wide flowers that open in bright sun and close on cloudy days and at night. The California poppy is considered an ancient plant whose origins are not entirely known. Native Americans in California prized them as a source of food and for the oil that could be extracted from the plant. Eschscholzia californica was the first named member of the genus Eschscholzia, which was named by the German botanist Adelbert von Chamisso after the Baltic German botanist Johann Friedrich von Eschscholtz, his friend and colleague on Otto von Kotzebue’s scientific expedition to California and the greater Pacific in mid-1810s aboard the Russian ship Rurik.
features: California Poppy Glycerite contains ONLY natural ingredients! Alcohol Free! Gluten Free! Non-GMO! | High Quality California Poppy NON-Alcohol liquid extract - we use classic conventional methods of extraction! We meticulously produce our extracts according to precise standards where each herb is extracted according to the distinct characteristic of each plant! | The highest quality California Poppy Glycerin based liquid extract made with love for plants and respect for Nature! | We strictly use Only Certified or ethically sourced wild harvested raw material, vegetable palm glycerin and crystal clear artesian purified water! Really the BEST California Poppy herbal glycerite on market!

review_body: I love this stuff! I used it to take the edge off when I quit smoking cigarettes two years ago. I quit cold turkey. Worked like a dream - no stress, no edgy crazy, and zero relapse. I picked this product back up again a few months ago when I was having some stressful times at work and it was just as useful. Will purchase again for sure!

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2024
review_body: I generally have a very hard time falling asleep. This is a great natural alternative to medication. It makes me sleepy and relaxed very quickly and I feel rested and sharp in the morning. I just put the drops directly under my tongue and hold them there for a couple of minutes before swallowing. Will never be without this product again!

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2024

review_title: Kava Can Be Addicting, That Should Be on the Labeling
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2024
review_body: I learned that Kava can be an addicting substance and that information is not listed on this supplement. It's not purely kava, so perhaps that's why there does not need to be a disclaimer. Aside from that, after using two bottles of this supplement, I did not notice any change in my anxiety. It didn't help me personally. The taste was pretty gross as well. I wouldn't spend my money on this supplement again.

name: Hawaii Pharm California Poppy Alcohol-Free Liquid Extract, Organic California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) Dried above-Ground Part Glycerite Natural Herbal Supplement 4 oz
description: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather.

review_title: BEST Sleep Aid I've Tried (Out of Tons)
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2021
review_body: This product is absolutely amazing. Look no further for a healthy natural and organic sleep aid. Effective, Taste Good, High Quality, Reasonable Price, and the company selling it seems ethical. Great energy. I wish this would come up when people searched sleep aid on Amazon, but unfortunately right now you need to search pretty specifically to find it.Read full review for more details.-I have had sleep issues since I was a teenager (30s now). A long time ago I took Ambien, but later switched to herbal remedies to get away from the dangers and downsides of that medication. I've tried everything I think is available such as; Catnip, Chamomile, Valerian, and California Poppy, various tinctures, teas, and pills containing them or other relaxing plants over the years.Out of them I found Valerian and Poppy to be the most effective on separate occasions (don't underestimate a strong Catnip tea though), but I had never tried them together so I ordered this product. It is very effective as expected, though with my sleep issues I do sometimes need more than the recommended .75ml. That's okay, it's a large bottle and at a price I find acceptable for such a high quality product. We'll see how long it lasts and I'll update the review, but based on my math it should last about 3 months taking a double dose, 6 months if you have only mild sleep trouble or are tiny like my partner.Oh, and, if you are aware that Poppy and Valerian both taste or smell awful - forget about it. This tincture tastes amazing. I have been baffled at how that's possible, maybe the glycerine base makes that big of a difference? However it happened, I actually ENJOY the taste of this, so there isn't the slightest resistance to taking it.I have a feeling this product will be on my nightstand for a long time, until I have the equipment to easily make a homemade vegetable glycerine tincture like this.

review_title: Use As Intended - Sleep, Relaxation, and Tim Ferriss. (Note - This Is Not For Pain)
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2015
review_body: I feel I have to leave a review here to give more of a balanced perspective on this product instead of the other reviews you're likely seeing from people that didn't do a whole lot of research before buying this product.TL:DR - Use this for relaxation and sleep. It's not an instant drowsiness but rather it feels as if you're naturally progressing towards sleep over 30-60min. DO NOT DRINK IT STRAIGHT. Take it with something sweet like orange juice. 15-20 drops outta do it. Also, the effects take longer to kick in if you take this and then continue to stare at a TV or computer screen.Detailed Background: My curiosity around California Poppy Seed Extract (CPSE) came from Tim Ferriss and his findings in The 4 Hour Body. There seemed to be some evidence that CPSE has some benefits around REM sleep. As someone who has trouble sleeping and wants to reduce the amount of sleep I need every day, this piqued my interest. So I went online, looked through a few academic papers, and pestered a few relatives that were pharmacists and doctors about this. Turns out, Tim's findings do hold some weight (although more rigorous studies and testing are definitely needed).I've been using this product for about 2-3 years now and I haven't had any issues. To be safe, I took Tim's advice and I stop taking this every three months for the duration of one month. And I've gone from using this every night to maybe 2-3 times a week and that's typically if I know I'm not going to get at least 6 hours of sleep. The boost to REM sleep definitely helps.I think one of the biggest takeaways is this isn't, at least in my case, an addictive substance and it doesn't have seem to have any significant side effects (unlike many major pharmaceutical products). If anything, it helped to train my body to get a regular sleep cycle and how to relax before bed. So that, even when I stop taking this for a month at a time, I still get a decent amount of sleep.So in short, the product works if you use it as intended. If you did zero research and you're going off the claims of Dr.Oz...frankly...you're kind of an idiot. Never trust one source, especially a celebrity. This doesn't magically cure pain. At least to my knowledge, I've never experienced it or come across any research that indicates that unless it's a placebo effect.Use this for sleep and relaxation, that's all. And if you want more info or struggle with either of those topics then I'd recommend taking a look through The 4 Hour Body. Several other tips there that have helped me out over the years.

review_title: Works well for minor pain or sleep problems
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2013
review_body: I'm still experimenting with dose but found even 7 or 8 drops directly to the tongue impart a gentle sedation for minor pain or sleep problems. The effect increases with larger dosage but I can see going through this wee bottle very quickly if you have moderate pain and need 20 or 30 drops. The effects fade after a couple hours. I wouldn't be comfortable using this at work or while driving as it makes me a little listless and sleepy.It tastes terrible--like fermented lawn clippings--but gets maximum effect dropped directly on my tongue. Even mixed in tea I can taste it but it blends in okay. I added it to a shot of Jack Daniels and the taste completely disappeared and made for a great nightcap on a restless night. Both poppy extract and a few bong loads of wild lettuce have proved to be effective for my occasional sleep or minor pain problems.

review_title: Was surprised by Poppy Extract effectiveness.
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2013
review_body: There are many products available which induce sleep in a variety of ways. The type of sleep also varies, as sleep comes at several different levels. Having grown California Poppies for decorative purposes, I was not aware of a medicinal application, and so I was somewhat dubious regarding effectiveness. This product did produce sleep when taken as directed. I used the product intermittently several times with similar results. The sleep was hypnotic in nature and without dreams. There was some residual grogginess the following day, but it was not intolerable. The product was not overly offensive to take with an interesting herb-like aroma and taste. So this California Poppy extract would be effective for occasional sleepless nights. I cannot offer an opinion about long term results.

review_body: I wouldn't buy my tinctures from any other source, they are caring and their quality is top notch, I have tried several other brands and even bought for awhile from a person who makes her own, (not advisable bc of hygenics)...  Hawaii pharm has this down pact!!!From a hopeful, personal point of view...I successfully weaned myself off of opiates with the use of California Poppy..I was taking 4 pills a day for over 8 years!!..I decided to try it on the advice of a local Herbalist who'd owed a store for many years, I tried it, it took a couple weeks to adjust and make allowances for "extra pain" I didn't experience with the opiate, BUT, it is worth giving up more physical activity to not be controlled by a substance that 1) "knocks you out"..2) causes organ damage,sleeplessness, trauma (such as sweats, diareah ,constipation, vomiting if you cannot get it)...It is more like a "whole " body pain relief, not so generalized..and no negative side effects.( and my doctor is on board with it!!)

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2012
review_body: I have fibromyalgia and have avoided using pharmaceuticals as much as possible. However, about once a month, my pain is so intense that I need something to break through the pain. I decided to try this since it was touted as a more natural alternative to the codones...and man, has it been a life saver! I just bought some passionflower and st.john's wort in dried form from another source to use as a calming tea at night, since sleep deprivation is one of the biggest issues in my fibromyalgia. I'm excited to see how those will work together. But as far as this product - it truly has been a life-saver and I'm only sorry that I waited so long to order the second bottle!

brand: HawaiiPharm California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) Certified Organic Liquid Extract 2 oz
name: HawaiiPharm California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) Certified Organic Liquid Extract 2 oz
description: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather.
features: California Poppy tincture contains ONLY natural ingredients! | High Quality California Poppy liquid extract - crude extract of first extraction! Really the BEST California Poppy extract on market!
review_title: After 2 weeks on it I can sleep more than 4 hours.
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2013
review_body: I work 3rd shift and have always been a night person but I have a hard time falling asleep and staying asleep even with Ambian.  I take it 2 times a day not 3  like recomended and I love it it has changed my life.  I'm not exausted all the time, I can think better, I sleep alot more now. I dont have kids,and I work 3rd shift, I have on and off health problems, so there are days I real have nothing I have to do and I have been able to sleep most of the day and evening which is fine with me, my body so can use the rest to heal itself.  And when I have stuff to do I'm not falling asleep tired when I have things to do because I'm sleeping Good when I do sleep.  I highly recomend this to anyone who's mind races when they got to bed. I use to get up and write things and draw scetches of products I should invent that was how fast my mind would race, or thinking I should be doing dishes or laundry or what ever task.  NowI lay down and I couldnt even tell you what my brain is thinking of and off to sleep I go. TRY IT !!

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2015
review_body: I am not a lucid dreamer so can not report on the product's effectiveness if that is your objective. I purchased as a sleep aid, and I am unsure if it helps me to sleep. I do believe that I have better dream recollection when I take it, and that my dreams may be more intense. Alas, as a light sleeper, I sometimes wake from the intensity of a dream, so as a sleep aid it isn't helping, but as an entertainment, it is. As for the taste, I happen to really and truly like the taste. To me it is delicious, almost sweet, and I enjoy allowing the tincture to linger in my mouth for the needed absorption time.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2013
review_body: I've had three lower spine surgeries in the past seven years and still have nerve pain that prevents me from getting a good night's sleep.  I don't want to rely strictly on prescription drugs for the rest of my life, so I tried this.  It doesn't solve all of my problems, but it does help, and I'll continue with it.  P.S. - I use 20 drops of the tincture in water before bed.  Any more and I get VERY sleepy very fast.  If that's your aim, then this might be worth a try.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2024
review_body: These California poppy supplements do make me feel a bit relaxed and chilled out, but it's quite subtle, you almost don't notice it unless you're really paying attention to how you're feeling. I took two the other day and the feeling was a bit more pronounced, but still not too strong. It did help me fall asleep and I think it helped me stay asleep too, although I did feel a bit groggy when I woke up the next day. Overall I'm pretty satisfied, it's nice to take a little edge off every now and then.

review_title: Because I’m not familiar with the use of poppy I wish they provided more information on the regimen
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2024
review_body: Because I don’t sleep well and have a difficult time relaxing this supplement caught my attention.  It is a 30 day supply (assuming 1 tablet a day but the bottle does say you can take up to 4) for under $10 (at the time of this review). I am never used poppy before so I don’t know exactly how I should use it and wish they provided better direction.  It doesn’t say to use it before bed and doesn’t warn about using it while driving or doing other things that require your attention.  I am taking one in the morning and it is too soon to see if I feel more relaxed during the day or sleep better.  I put a photo against another bottle to show that it comes in a bottle about half the size of other bottles.  I applaud the company for this as too often you get a lot of unnecessary packaging and this company seems to be sensitive to that issue.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2024
review_body: I really wanted to like these and really wanted to be impressed with its effects. But that just wasn't the case for me. The only thing I noticed with these tablets is that I felt sleepy. But I'm unsure to if that was placebo or perhaps I was just genuinely tired. I've tried other products made by this brand, and just about every product I've tried has extremely small text on the bottle. It is difficult to read the dosage information and content information. I don't know why they can't just increase the size of the font, but it's been a little frustrating.

description: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather.

name: Gaia Herbs Black Elderberry, NightTime Syrup - Immune Support Supplement - With Organic Black Elderberries, California Poppy & Lemon Balm for Restful Sleep & Immune Defense - 5.4 Fl Oz (32-Day Supply)
description: For centuries Black Elderberries have been recognized for supporting the immune system. Gaia Herbs Black Elderberry NightTime Syrup super-concentrates the juice from 14.5 grams of organic Elderberries into a single teaspoon. Another important aspect of optimal health is restful sleep. Black Elderberry NightTime Syrup contains the organic herbs Lemon Balm and California Poppy to gently support a good night of rest.
features: Elderberry Syrup Immune Support: A delicious nightly tonic to support immune health & sleep* | An Antioxidant Support: Elderberry Syrup has often been used to maintain the body’s natural defenses | Powerful Elderberry Formula: Each serving has the equivalent of 14.5 g of fresh elderberries | Purity-Tested: Our organic vegan Elderberry Syrup is non-habit forming & proudly made in NC, USA | Our Story: Since 1987, our purpose has been to connect people, plants, and planet to create healing
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2011
review_body: As a practicing herbalist for many years (for personal use, not as a professional) and an advocate holistic practices I've found that Gaia herbs has always had quality products and I was happy to find this one available here on Subscribe and Save.  My family has been taking both formulas of the Black Elderberry syrup (the standard version and the Nighttime) as a supplements throughout the cold and flu season with excellent results.It's concentrated. You take one teaspoonful once a day, twice only if needed. I've found that it's not overly sedative which is a plus.  It has something of a mild relaxing effect keeping in mind that your mileage may vary.  The potency of the formula is focused in the immunity support that the Black Elderberries provide. It's manufactured in Italy where it's a traditional medicine with these additional organic ingredients:  Acerola, California Poppy, Lemon Balm, Grindelia, Sugar Cane (4g of sugar per serving), water, and Lemon Juice. I've come to really like this product and will be sure to keep a bottle of each formula on hand all year round, so I recommend it highly.

review_title: Very Helpful for Nighttime Cough and Immune Boost
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2015
review_body: My children were hit with a serious cold/flu thanks to flu vaccinated grandparents "shedding". I know this was the source because I homeschool and my children don't go to daycare. My parents went to the doctor to get antibiotics but my children were given Black Elderberry Syrup, Black Elderberry NightTime Syrup, vitamins, tea (lemon, honey and a little salt) and a small spoonful of diced garlic and honey. My children recovered within two weeks (that's how nasty the bug was) my parents were sick for nearly a month with the cough lingering even longer.I used this product sparingly at night to give relief from the nasty cough and put an oil diffuser in their room to help with nasal congestion.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2024
review_body: Broadcast a palm full of the tiny seeds across the surface of my raised bed garden with a high peat based soil did minimal covering several days of sun and rain resulted in ferny plants emerging forming a "grass" each sent up a second offset set of ferny leaves and kept waiting for a second stem to appear between them which never happened was concerned about trying to thin this dense carpet of plants, then overnight a yellow flower and pink flower appeared the yellow opened up to a flat daisy like appearance guess I was expecting more of a oriental poppy, so was surprising to me this is the first seed planted flower to bloom ( s hollyhocks, etc) so very pleased about things can't wait to see all the wonderful colors.

review_title: Bought as a stand-in for my usual sleep supplement, but now I'm adding it in my regular regimen!
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2023
review_body: I am a very light sleeper with a racing mind. My biggest issue is not falling asleep, but staying asleep particularly in the morning hours. My brain is so active that I can "worry myself awake". Very frustrating!The tried-and-true supplement I rely on is RidgeCrest Herbs DreamOn Zen formula. I take TWO doses because of my mind's ability to bust through the herbs and think myself awake anyway.BUT with this, I took two doses and slept very very soundly through the night AND morning! Yay! And I have vivid long dreams which I LOVE.The only potential negative, which I do not care about and do not personally consider to be negative, is that compared to the DreamOn Zen, it doesn't help me fall asleep. I don't have issues falling asleep, but I do notice now that something about DreamOn Zen helped make me feel sleepier and go to sleep faster.My new plan is to take one dose of this plus one dose of DreamOn Zen instead of two doses of either one separately.So if your brain situation sounds like mine, try this. And honestly I also highly recommend trying DreamOn Zen too.

review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2023
review_body: I have trouble sleeping and know that what may work for others sometimes may not work for me. However, the Secret of the Tribe’s promise of full refund is what makes it a scam. After trying their product and finding that it did nothing for me, even after more than doubling the recommended dosage I tried to return it and ended on a chat that supposedly approved my return, but could not tell me where to mail the product. It told me to use the rerun address in my confirmation email, but there was no return address in said email. Then I was directed to call the customer service line, but when I did what I got was a recoded message selling me new products and subscriptions. And though I said I wasn’t interested I was transferred to said promotions, since it was a non interactive recording, which transferred to the promotional line regardless of my response. There was no life person to talk to. In other words I got approval to return, but was given zero directions or guidance on how to make said return.I call that a scam.

review_title: Non-native seeds sold as California Wildflowers
review_location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2024
review_body: This seed mix is described as California Native plants but when seeded it contains mostly non-native species (flower bed dominated by Calendula officinalis, Lobularia maritima (sweet Alyssum), and Cynoglossum amabile (Chinese forget-me-not), with some Centaurea cyanus (cornflower), Consolida ajacis (doubtful knight's spur), and common poppy. Of 8 species the only 2 native species are California poppy (many seeds) and Clarkia unguiculata (very few seeds). This is especially bad when you have a garden with otherwise only native plants since many of these species are spreading very easily (and have become introduced in many places in North America).
